edu.doane.dugal.dea.kits.general

Class StandardStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.doane.dugal.dea.kits.general.StandardStats
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Operator

    public class StandardStats
extends java.lang.Object
implements Operator
    Class to do standard population statistics (min, max, average, and best- ever fitness), and dump them to standard output. Do not re-use objects of this class; use a new one for each run, so that best-ever values are reset.
    Version:
    12/26/2014
    Author:
    Mark M. Meysenburg

    • Constructor Detail

      • StandardStats

        public StandardStats()
        Default constructor. Create an instance with the best-ever fitness set to negative infinity, the best-ever Individual reference set to null, and the number of decimal places to display in output set to 4.

      • StandardStats

        public StandardStats(int decimalPlaces)
        Initializing constructor. Create an instance with the best-ever fitness set to negative infinity, the best-ever Individual reference set to null, and the number of decimal places to display in output set to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        decimalPlaces - Number of decimal places to show in output.

    • Method Detail

      • getBestEverIndividual

        public Individual getBestEverIndividual()
        Get a reference to the best individual ever seen during a run.
        Returns:
        Individual reference to the best critter seen during the run.

      • operate

        public void operate(java.util.ArrayList<Individual> population)
        Find min, max, and average fitness for the specified population, and output to standard output.
        Specified by:
        operate in interface Operator
        Parameters:
        population - ArrayList of Individuals to get statistics for.
